fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37330].
  {panel}

We have our custom filed Epic Name locked and we have included only epic with the issue type, but for some reason we see user story also getting included in the issue types, we have removed the user story issue types but on many occasion with out changing any configuration we end up having the same issue and it becomes impossible to create a user story without proving the epic Name

The issue has occured more than 3 times please let me know if this is any known issue and let me know if there is any permenant fix for this.

Let me know if you need more information.

BR

Ravish Raju
fields.summary: Epic Name is Mandatory even while creating user story.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37329].
  {panel}

I imported my data from JIRA 6.1.5 where I had defined custom checkbox. 
First time it shows up normally. I had both check boxes selected.
1. I deselected "two" from issue screen, everything still is OK as in Screenshot1.png
2. When I want to edit it again, I see them overlapping with "two" in front of "one" without any possibility to check or un-check "one". I can still check "two". See Screenshot2.png

I am not sure if it helps, but I attached Screenshot3.png that shows configuration of this checkbox field.

Kind regards,
Lauma
fields.summary: Checkboxes overlapping in JIRA 6.2
Validation on assignee field when closing issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37326].
  {panel}

Closed issues for an epic do not show the resolution, but this is crucial information to easily see which changes were

    done,
    deferred (i.e., will likely be fixed later),
    rejected (i.e., will not be fixed at all),
    duplicated (i.e., will be / have been fixed using a different ticket).

Take a look at the attached screenshot/mock for clarification.
!Issue Resolution in Epic.png!
Legend:
|| Icon || Resolution ||
| (-) | Rejected |
| (off) | Deferred |
| (!) | Duplicate |
| (/) | Resolved |
_empty_ Not resolved |

I know that greenhopper aka agile is responsible for the panel (issues-in-epic-panel.vm), but since I couldn't file an improvement there, I thought I'd file one with JIRA. Feel free to move this request to Agile.
fields.summary: Show issue resolution on "issues in Epic" panel
OnDemand signup email makes no sense to end-users

As of JRA-3758 it is possible to show the "Link Issue" field on any screen.
As duplicates are a core concept, it should be possible to support users even a little more on Resolve screens.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37300].
  {panel}

When attempting to move a subtask from one parent to another, the drop down menu in the parent issue field does not show an ellipsis.
This cuts off the summary of the issues displayed in the drop down, making it hard to determine which parent issue to choose if the summary is longer than the field permits to get displayed.

In a similar situation under the link issue section, the ellipsis is present and the whole summary is properly readable.

Steps to reproduce:
# Open a sub-task
# Choose "Move" from the More options
# Choose "Change Parent" from the "Choose Operation" page
# On the next page, start typing in the parent issue field in order for the drop down menu to show up
fields.summary: Issue summary on sub-task parent move not showing ellipsis

fields.description:
When I (and others) create a new project in JIRA, we get a Permission Violation error (see the attached screenshot). It's been happening the past couple of versions--since around November of 2013. 

When this first happened I checked my permissions--I'm an administrator --but was given system administration permissions and I still got the error. When I went to create that project again--it said that name and ID code was already in use. After logging out and in a few times, the project finally appeared and I could apply permissions, notifications, etc. 

We are running 6.1. We can't figure out what is happening. I've searched your support area and find nothing--looking at the user/ permission area of your documentation has not helped. We should be fine!

We want to upgrade to 6.2 but when we took a look at it in our dev environment we cannot successfully create a project at all. Still get the permissions violation--but no project ever, ever gets created. Though it won't let me use that project name/id. I fear that we'll lose the ability to successfully create a project if we put 6.2 into production and I know there's security vulnerability fix. The permission violation has been a pain (and haven't had a chance to raise the issue--until now) but at least the project eventually showed up.

I have a sys admin dwagley@keymind.com who maintains the server/db,etc. 

We are running Java 1.7.0_25
postgres72 8.4.20
OS: Linux 2.6.32-431.5.1.e16x86_64
Apache Tomcat/7.0.29
JIRA: 6.1.1.

Thanks!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37268].
  {panel}

One of our clients asked us to debug some weird behaviour on Chrome browser, so we did, over the wire. They say the behaviour is erratic (i.e. some have it, some don't).
Links to the original issues (requires creation of an account):

http://bugs.kepler-rominfo.com/browse/KBA-21
http://bugs.kepler-rominfo.com/browse/KBA-22

Env: poor network conditions(!), Chrome latest (Chrome 33.0.1750117M), *JIRA in safe mode* ( i.e. no plugins enabled).

Problem: Besides it's slow to load (which is understandable), Chrome time-outs on some resources, randomly picked, and everything will blow up, eventually. F5+F5 in the browser, page remains blank.
It is worth to note that sometimes the pages were loaded very fast, sometimes very slow if at all.

Puzzling: FF and IE do not have the same behaviour, even for those poor network conditions. They act slow, but the resources (js, images, etc) are loaded, eventually.

I sincerely do not believe this is a JIRA problem, but rather a Chrome one, however it should be investigated and reported, if it is confirmed, to the Chromium team.
fields.summary: Chrome fails to load pages / acting slow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37262].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In support from time to time, we get users who have renewed a plugin license key, contact us about trouble updating the license key, or guidiance finding where to put the new license key. Below is a screenshot of what the plugin details screen where the license key is updated in the UPM looks like:
!license.png|width=100%!

Example of feedback we got from 2 customers recently is:
bq. I actually checked that screen like ten times for a way to enter the new license but always overlooked that pencil button. It might make sense to provide a direct link to the license setting when a license did expire.

bq. Manually installing the licence did work. But finding the Pen Button besides the licence key was not easy

h3. Suggested Solution
Updating the license key is not something that people have to do often, it's perhaps understandable that it's a bit out of sight. However, perhaps we can create a more intuitive way to update plugin license keys, especially after a plugin license has expired? Perhaps a notification that logged in Admins can see, which when clicked, pops up a field to paste-in  the license key directly. This could then automatically direct the user to the updated plugin screen page as a confirmation.
fields.summary: Improve visibility for where to update plugin license key

h3. Summary

Checking notifications for issues where the event type uses a Multi Select CF with a group in it does not validate correctly and advises that the user should not be notified when they should be.

h3. Environment

Version is 1.10.1 but this is not available from this project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add a Multi Select Custom Field.
# Configure it to have an option with a group in it, e.g.: {{jira-administrators}} as per the attached screenshot.
# Add this Custom Field to the notification scheme.

h3. Expected Results

They are listed as being notified.

h3. Actual Results

They are not listed as being notified.

h3. Notes

The value of the Multi Select field is case insensitive, so {{JIRA-ADMINISTRATORS}} will match the {{jira-administrators}} group (verified in 6.0.8).

fields.description:
If a user that has an non-deliverable email address/account is a watcher for an issue, updating that issue will trigger an infinite loop of failure emails being converted to issue comments.

1- create a mail handler to create and update issues
2- set a user with a bad email address or other problem as a watcher to an issue or in notification scheme.
3 - update the issue

The email server replies with a reject notification. The rejection notice email is treated like an update to the issue, which in turn creates another email notification that the issue was updated. The bad account is notified again which repeats until the user is removed as a watcher from all issues or the email account/address is corrected/able to accept mail again.  If this goes unnoticed, hundreds of updates are added to an issue.
This is from an MS Exchange Mail Server:
David Weiss added a comment - Yesterday 10:18 PM:
Delivery has failed to these recipients or distribution lists:
<bad email address>
The recipient's e-mail address was not found in the recipient's e-mail system. Microsoft Exchange will not try to redeliver this message for you. Please check the e-mail address and try resending this message, or provide the following diagnostic text to your system administrator.

This could also happen on inbox full with mail servers that reject each message regardless of the sender being notified once already.
The system also updates issues with out of office replies, but mail servers only send one reply per sender.  That's considered a minor irritant but worth mentioning.
fields.summary: Infinite comment notification loop when email delivery fails

Dear all
we have upgraded from JIRA 4.4.5 to JIRA 6.1.7 today. After that, we have recognized that there are problems with message custom fields (for view and edit):
we use this type of field for displaying our own workflow-figures via having an html script as standard value of the particular field with links to the corresponding figure.

Some (but not all) of the existing fields are kind of broken now. We cannot save any value in this field any more and the old standard values have disappeared.
Within one field, it also happens that one of the existing context is affected and anotherone not.
The biggest problem is that we even cannot save any value for this fields any more, JIRA simply does not save the value, but without any error message.
MEans we even vannot restore the fields from backup data. I would need to create all fields from scratch as it seems that new fields (created within JIRA 6.1.7) are not affected.

This happens on all migrated systems (test system and production) means is reproducable for us.

We cannot switch to JIRA 6.2 as this migration has a lot of plugin-dependencies and is quite a lot of work for us. We need a fix for 6.1.7...

thanks for your help, this is really quite urgent for us as we are having lots of different projects within JIRA (approx 300) which means a lot of different workflow-fields (message custom fields).

best regards

Birgit Greiffenberg

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37201].
  {panel}

It is a problem that the import of data requires 'JIRA Administrators global permission'

If someone wishes to migrate from other systems to JIRA Agile their first thought would be 'How do I import data from my current backlog to JIRA.'

When I started out with the role as Lead I expected by intuition the import feature under the systems menu in administration of the project to be available to me. However it was not and I have now discovered that the import not only changes the project that I wish to Import to but potentially could damage other projects...

I suggest giving access to the import feature per default to project leads, because it is necessary to get an easy import and that it will be more convincing in regard of moving teams from other platforms to JIRA. When migrating, the import experience is the thing that could scare people away (make it or break it) from the platform if it is to tiresome/complex.

Also change the import to be isolated to the current project so that other projects still are 'safe' when doing imports would be a good idea.
fields.summary: Simplify Complicated Access to Import of CSV Data to Agile Boards

From working with just a small influx of bug report on a few of my project i noticed it can be difficult to deal with the report. Mainly duplicate bug reports, and poorly created bug reports can be a main. I've found this is mainly due to users not knowing how to check for duplicate issues, and how to generate reports. So my suggestions to solve this are as follow

### 1) Custom section for report types
The idea is to allow repo owners to divide up the bug report area into different pages. Say one page for actual issues, another for tweeks to settings, and another for suggestions. This way users don't get confused on what is a bug and was is a request. Currently i've been handling this with filter but that only helps the devs out. Most basic users don't use filters to search threw bugs. 

### 2) Bug report templates
Repo owners should have the option to setup a report template that auto fills into the bug report. This way the user can answer simple questions that we always ask them. For example the version number of the software they have. 

### 3) FAQ , and instruction page 
It would be very useful for a FAQ & instruction page to open up for users before they report an issue. This way users can see that we want a set guide line for report. I've tried handling this with an issue report that list guide lines, but it floats to the bottom of the report list.

### 4) Sticky report
Common bug report should have the option to be stickied to the top of the report list. This way users can find the report faster, and i can keep basic info report in sight.
fields.summary: [Feature Request] Bug reporting improvements

fields.description:
I found this...

The suggestions in Assignee dropdown are calculated in the following manner :
1. First Jira picks up a list of last (maximum) 5 users that the current user has assigned issues to (say Tony, Jack, Alex, Rita, James).
2. Then Jira picks up a list of users that this issue has been assigned to in the past (say Ram).
3. After this, Jira adds to this, the reporter of this issue (say Ram).
4. After this, the list is compiled and the duplicates are removed (with above example we will have Tony, Jack, Alex, Rita, James, Ram in the list).
5. Lastly, they are arranged in the ascending order (Alex, Jack, James, Ram, Rita, Tony) and then displayed in the Assignee dropdown.

Check all of the screen shot in the right order...

In this test cas the only premise that should be executed is the #1 (First Jira picks up a list of last (maximum) 5 users that the current user has assigned issues to), the #3 (After this, Jira adds to this, the reporter of this issue), the #4 (After this, the list is compiled and the duplicates are removed) and the #5 (arranged in the ascending order)...

So what wrong? Why Chantal, Nanacy and Patrick are always there?
Why Véronique do not stay in the list after the first assignation?
fields.summary: The suggestions in Assignee dropdown do not seems to work correctly
